data.text: Is high public debt cause for alarm? As governments around the world are taking on debt at levels surpassing those during World War II, some governments will be in a better position to sustain their debt than others. https://t.co/F4rCzrm79r https://t.co/MGaGqsPleU
Prices of oil and gas have soared since the war in Ukraine. Watch our video to learn about the impact of rising prices and how countries can respond. https://t.co/yaiJHqdsOS https://t.co/QQwawFRyX5

Join @CeylaP_IMF at the @_TorontoCentre on Wednesday June 29 for insight on how to build resilient economies.
🍁Register here➡️https://t.co/wIkI5yEl0M https://t.co/HqKU4V6ABj

Countries face several complex challenges, including high inflation and debt, energy and food insecurity, and an increasingly fragmented world. Learn about our plans for the year ahead: https://t.co/uCfbXB7upV https://t.co/lZ1UNSqiq2

Countries in Sub-Saharan Africa are using digitalization to improve the quality of public institutions. Read our latest IMF Country Focus to learn more. https://t.co/REMnjBM9pj https://t.co/vVNkOktYcW

The digital currency race has kicked off in Sub-Saharan Africa. Read our latest #IMFBlog to find out which countries in the region are exploring digital currencies. https://t.co/qlxIYk5Fwh https://t.co/oDualKMtF5

The IMF’s Global Financial Stability Report has changed in its 20 years, placing greater focus on climate and the linkages between the economy and the financial sector. https://t.co/PIp7xCgtFT https://t.co/dKhVU4ScAz

The IMF Executive Board completed today the first review of the Extended Fund Facility arrangement for #Argentina 🇦🇷, which allows for an immediate disbursement of US $ 4.01 billion. 
https://t.co/34kMTlP44L
📝 IMF Staff Concluding Statement of the 2022 Article IV mission for the 🇺🇸  United States. Read the details here: https://t.co/E1kabnjEFv https://t.co/HqJYsYeyjA

How much has social unrest risen in the last year? Find out in our new Charts in Motion and read about the costs of social unrest: https://t.co/NqxBCWoGl9 https://t.co/vb7T4a5bry

An IMF team including Middle East Director Jihad Azour and Chief Economist @pogourinchas met with young entrepreneurs in Morocco 🇲🇦 to discuss their prospects and challenges. 
Key issues on their mind: access to finance, regulation, finding & retaining talent. https://t.co/4JDD7jIJss

Tune in LIVE to the press conference on the 🇺🇸 United States’ economy with @KGeorgieva, @IMFSpokesperson, IMF’s Western Hemisphere Department Director Ilan Goldfajn, & IMF Mission Chief Nigel Chalk. 

🔴 June 24 at 4 PM ET. https://t.co/EflpOJ8X8S https://t.co/hWimVEtRXJ

Why does good governance matter? We interview the authors of a new IMF book to discuss how transparency and public integrity impact development. Read more here. https://t.co/REMnjBM9pj https://t.co/9PUElIMEww

Nigeria 🇳🇬 was the second country in the world to officially launch a central bank digital currency. For more on developments in Sub-Saharan Africa, read our latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/qlxIYk5Fwh https://t.co/2xfMTVWsyH

What can we expect for the future of work? We asked Nobel Laureate Christopher Pissarides (@LSEnews) at the 2022 IMF Economic Review conference @BankAlMaghrib.

👉 His thoughts: embrace new technologies as they provide an opportunity to improve working conditions. https://t.co/znXJRRTwgZ

The IMF’s Global Financial Stability Report, now in its 20th year, tends to put more emphasis on systemic vulnerabilities when access to funding is easier. Check out our #IMFBlog for more.https://t.co/PIp7xCgtFT https://t.co/sy3RVWJJ4B

📢 Last call for papers for the 3rd joint annual workshop on international capital flows and financial policies organized by the IMF, @bankofengland, @banquedefrance, @bancaditalia, and @OECD. 
All details here: https://t.co/LIgJYYNMyC 
📅 Deadline: June 30, 2022
Following the recent staff visit, the IMF’s Morocco team met with members of civil society in 🇲🇦 to discuss economic and social developments in the country. https://t.co/z7dUFNBOtx

The IMF’s Global Financial Stability Report just turned 20, and the surveillance tool has changed quite a bit over two decades to reflect new risks and evolving needs. Read more in our #IMFBlog: https://t.co/PIp7xCgtFT https://t.co/6OuDULNzY7

Investing in the initial integration of refugees is an economic opportunity for countries—once employed, the income refugees generate is much larger than the cost of integration. Read the F&D Café Economics interview with @UCD_GlobalMC Giovanni Peri. https://t.co/k308T6teXO https://t.co/75Itdx7WyA

New IMF research shows how the technological design choices for digital currencies can make a major difference for their energy efficiency—and in turn reduce harmful carbon emissions. #IMFBlog https://t.co/80vaOlLM2s https://t.co/POexmffbeH

Central bank digital currencies and some kinds of crypto can be more energy efficient than many current payment options, like credit cards. See #IMFBlog for more. https://t.co/80vaOlLM2s https://t.co/geMJyGfuJJ

Despite progress, economists still pay scant attention to race relative to other topics, writes @LosavioJoe in F&D. Only a tiny share of academic articles cover race, racial inequality, and racism. Read more here: https://t.co/dT9bkEiT1S #Juneteenth https://t.co/p5rUGe4njN
Where are the world’s fastest roads? A new IMF measure of road quality across 162 countries uses data from Google Maps. Read the #IMFBlog https://t.co/KIlREkOLhC https://t.co/dsxL3p4wF1

We are encouraged by the upcoming meeting of the official creditor committee and urge rapid financing assurances. https://t.co/t5Fye6Jjm2 https://t.co/1gAVCjCJEZ

IMF's DMD Antoinette M. Sayeh: I had good meetings with President @HHichilema and Minister @S_Musokotwane in Lusaka 🇿🇲. Zambia's implementation to date of its homegrown economic program is impressive, including the authorities’ focus on education & social welfare. https://t.co/r8JOyCniT6

Moldovans opened their hearts and homes to 🇺🇦refugees who are determined to cope under difficult circumstances. We at the IMF are doing our part, but more financial support, including grants, is direly needed to support 🇲🇩. (2/2) https://t.co/nQ1caVJMYU

DMD Kenji Okamura: I had an excellent meeting with Moldova’s Prime Minister @natgavrilita. The IMF looks forward to continuing our successful collaboration in helping 🇲🇩 advance important reforms and build long-term resilience. https://t.co/O21tox1bAQ https://t.co/E2L04wDfZb

Pleased to hear that Moldova is taking steps towards ensuring energy efficiency and diversification, said IMF DMD Kenji Okamura following discussions with🇲🇩 Deputy Prime Minister @AndreiSpinu and a visit to the Termoelectrica power plant. https://t.co/BZEelylHcj

IMF DMD Kenji Okamura witnesses first-hand the disruption to trade due to the war in Ukraine and infrastructure bottlenecks while visiting the Moldova-Romania border with Finance Minister Dumitru Budianschi. https://t.co/kpTT4AxHD2

New IMF staff paper argues that countries  need carefully designed prudential policies & financial safety nets to address risks to financial stability. How can countries implement public banks' effective regulation and supervision? LIVE June 14, 9 AM ET. https://t.co/F2ZVW3xSc5

Moldova’s Minister of Labor and Social Protection Marcel Spatari guides IMF DMD Kenji Okamura through MoldExpo, the largest refugee center in 🇲🇩, showing @GuvernulRMD’s continuing humanitarian efforts and support for Ukrainian refugees. https://t.co/u8sDkVEfON
https://t.co/1niBLT0Y6p

At the #GoodGovernance conference, IMF’s Sayeh highlighted key pillars of good governance and transparency to help unlock the economic potential of countries. Read the remarks here: https://t.co/6vYavVWZp7 https://t.co/Ko038NwuM0
IMF financial support under the ECF/EFF arrangements was recently increased to help Moldova address challenges emanating from the war in Ukraine. (2/2).

On his first visit to Moldova, IMF DMD Kenji Okamura commended President @sandumaiamd for @GuvernulRMD’s hospitality towards Ukrainian refugees and unwavering commitment to reforms despite a difficult environment. He reiterated the IMF’s continued support to 🇲🇩. (1/2) https://t.co/yUlEJtkLWg

Countries need carefully designed prudential policies and financial safety nets to address risks to financial stability posed by public banks, a new IMF staff paper argues. Read more: https://t.co/MswFd3HPbu https://t.co/cx138ihMY7

Public banks can play a role to ease economic stress but may pose risks to financial stability. How can countries effectively regulate, supervise, and handle distress in public banks? Tune in to our LIVE discussion on June 14 at 9 AM ET. 🔴 https://t.co/Ix0CkTzJ2j https://t.co/EGGCFah8Xx

The IMF is stepping up its efforts to tackle fragility through economic policy, while also building new partnerships with institutions that work on development, humanitarian aid, and peace building. 

Learn more:

Just released: New report by the @FinStbBoard and the IMF lays out priorities for a new #G20 Data Gaps Initiative aimed at addressing data gaps and better informing policymakers on climate change, inclusion, and financial innovation policies. https://t.co/ex5cPwQP3F https://t.co/ltUiMsIyTH

Phasing out coal could provide a net benefit in the tens of trillions of dollars over the next eight decades, according to a recent IMF working paper that underscores the importance of putting a price on carbon. #IMFBlog https://t.co/WD0j7MXqtX https://t.co/OC45sjDDgm

Congratulations to the winning teams of the Climate Innovation Challenge! Watch the event replay and stay tuned to see how the teams operationalize their ideas https://t.co/LCqq3euxfK #IMFinnovation @SECO_CH @WorldResources https://t.co/0r1Itjm4MM

Today, IMF Deputy Managing Director Kenji Okamura delivered a keynote speech at the Conference under the Three Seas Initiative (3SI) hosted by the National Bank of Poland. Read his speech here: https://t.co/wFBqH6LIXQ https://t.co/FPpjcm6tLJ

A key concern about phasing out coal is that replacing it with renewables would be too expensive, but IMF Director Tobias Adrian and coauthors show in new research that benefits far exceed costs. #IMFBlog https://t.co/WD0j7MXqtX https://t.co/lxsHr9H4F7

The @FinStbBoard and the IMF announce the completion of the #G20 initiative to close data gaps identified during the Global Financial Crisis. In addition, a new initiative to address data gaps relating to emerging policy needs is being planned. Learn more: https://t.co/R4MmcVLRme https://t.co/DB2PWbbIex

‘For Whom the Bell Tolls’ brings new evidence on the link between climate change and income inequality, finding that an increase in climate vulnerability is positively associated with rising income inequality, particularly in developing countries.

https://t.co/IbF2PGMIfm https://t.co/7Vl5OsiXoG

‘Rogue Waves' examines the impact of climate change on business performance, finding that nonfinancial firms operating in vulnerable countries have more difficulty accessing debt financing and are less productive and profitable than firms elsewhere.

https://t.co/sOqqAILevM https://t.co/JGzs0vXiz5

In 'Jobs Impact of Green Energy,' we explore how green energy is more job-intensive than brown energy. So investing in green energy and energy efficiency can be a net job-creator, including in large emerging markets that are key for climate mitigation. 
https://t.co/6QV7iJjrgA https://t.co/jVgYkQ5Gmg

For over a decade, we've taken steps to reduce our impact on the environment, while supporting countries to adopt and implement policies designed to mitigate, contain, and reduce emissions. #WorldEnvironmentDay #OnlyOneWorld
 
👇Here are some of our latest climate-related reports https://t.co/f5qUqTmI1a

We are facing a more fragmented world, which could shake social and political stability and weaken the world’s ability to confront challenges like climate change and inequality. Read the letter from the editor in this F&D issue: https://t.co/yPy0C3Fr4L https://t.co/gs0Glmwe4x
The latest in the F&D’s “Picture This” series looks at how three compounding crises—conflict, COVID-19, and climate change—are giving rise to another one involving hunger. https://t.co/PoUlve2X6Z

Fragility and conflict impose heavy human cost. Join us tomorrow for our conference opening session where a panel will explore how macroeconomic policies can help support fragile and conflict affected states. 
📅 June 6, 9AM ET
Learn more:

What is carbon pricing? In short, it would make clean energy sources like solar and wind cheaper than dirty ones polluting the environment. https://t.co/sGkXdrOVAt #OnlyOneEarth https://t.co/FJxMCWqjhQ

🆕 The June issue of F&D explores the current geo-economic landscape amid a slowing global recovery, rising inflation, deglobalization, and shrinking policymaking space. Find the new issue here: https://t.co/CT2rbCnXXY https://t.co/T2Fmmkof3x

"The rare confluence of geopolitical, economic, and technological forces now confronting the world may reverberate for generations," writes F&D editor-in-chief Gita Bhatt in our June issue. Read her editor’s letter—on “A More Fragmented World”—here: https://t.co/yPy0C3Fr4L https://t.co/4J2KMRy6wi
